p: Ross River virus is an Australian mosquito-borne alphavirus that is the causative agent of Ross River virus disease, previously known as epidemic polyarthritis. The disease typically presents as a peripheral symmetric polyarthralgia or polyarthritis, accompanied during the acute phase by fever, rash, and/or myalgia. Arthritic symptoms can last for 3 to 6 months, generally with no long-term sequelae. Diagnosis is usually undertaken by IgM serology using a commercially available kit. Differential diagnoses include other arthritogenic alphaviruses and other infectious or autoimmune arthritides. Disease symptoms are usually treated with paracetamol or non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs.
